title: How to Take a Stuffed Animal on a Trip

steps.headline: Choose something you're going to put your stuffed animal's things in.
steps.description: This might be a bag, a suitcase, a school bag or a beach bag. Choose any bag that is small, light and strong. Ask your parents if the bag size is okay for the trip, as there will probably be many other things to take too.

steps.headline: Choose the clothes.
steps.description: Pick some pajamas, everyday clothes, party dresses, swimsuits, etc.

steps.headline: Pick out accessories.
steps.description: Pick accessories that match your stuffed animal's clothes.

steps.headline: Choose some shoes.
steps.description: Choose some shoes that fits with the clothes.

steps.headline: Add in any extra supplies.
steps.description: You can choose anything in this step, such as blankets and pillows (big enough for your stuffed animal).

steps.headline: Add in any toys and games so that your stuffed animal isn't bored during the long trip.

parts.name: Preparing Your Stuffed Animal for the Trip

steps.headline: Check that your stuffed animal is in good condition.
steps.description: Does it need a clean, perhaps a spot clean or a whole wash and dry? Are its arms, legs and eyes all stitched on well or is some mending needed? Fix anything before the trip, to ensure that your stuffed animal is in good shape when you actually travel.

steps.headline: Prepare your stuffed animal for the trip.
steps.description: Take the stuffed animal on short car rides to get him/her used to being out of the house and tell him/her about all the fun stuff they are going to do on the trip.

steps.headline: Put your stuffed animal on your lap and let him/her look out the window.
Make sure that your stuffed animal is well-rested so that they can stay awake on the trip.
Share food.
steps.description: If you are stopping at a restaurant or gift shop, then let them have a bit of your meal so that they aren't hungry. You could also buy them a small gift to reward them for being good during the long car trip (if they are good).

steps.headline: Play together.
steps.description: If they are bored, let them play with the toys and games you packed.

text: Packing for Your Stuffed Animal Choose something you're going to put your stuffed animal's things in. This might be a bag, a suitcase, a school bag or a beach bag. Choose any bag that is small, light and strong. Ask your parents if the bag size is okay for the trip, as there will probably be many other things to take too. Choose the clothes. Pick some pajamas, everyday clothes, party dresses, swimsuits, etc. Pick out accessories. Pick accessories that match your stuffed animal's clothes. Choose some shoes. Choose some shoes that fits with the clothes. Add in any extra supplies. You can choose anything in this step, such as blankets and pillows (big enough for your stuffed animal). Add in any toys and games so that your stuffed animal isn't bored during the long trip.  Preparing Your Stuffed Animal for the Trip Check that your stuffed animal is in good condition. Does it need a clean, perhaps a spot clean or a whole wash and dry? Are its arms, legs and eyes all stitched on well or is some mending needed? Fix anything before the trip, to ensure that your stuffed animal is in good shape when you actually travel. Prepare your stuffed animal for the trip. Take the stuffed animal on short car rides to get him/her used to being out of the house and tell him/her about all the fun stuff they are going to do on the trip. Taking the Trip Together Go on the trip!  Put your stuffed animal on your lap and let him/her look out the window.  Make sure that your stuffed animal is well-rested so that they can stay awake on the trip.  Share food. If you are stopping at a restaurant or gift shop, then let them have a bit of your meal so that they aren't hungry. You could also buy them a small gift to reward them for being good during the long car trip (if they are good). Play together. If they are bored, let them play with the toys and games you packed.
